title: My new profile is haunted!
content:
I've been having trouble downloading my mail, so I finally decided to try creating a new profile. It worked, except that there is a "#news" folder under my new profile which contains literally hundreds of subfolders, none of which I have created. I scrolled through to try and illustrate the problem and it took 92 screenshots to capture them all!

I tried deleting the "#news" folder and it seemed to work, but then when I clicked on the new Inbox it all came back again. I'm including the first few of the 92 (!) screenshots I took of the subfolders so you can see the context and get an idea of what I'm talking about.

How can I get rid of this phantom folder (and all its ghostly subfolders) in a way that it won't come back? Thank you!

title: Sometimes issues receiving e-mails
content: Good afternoon, from time to time we have had issues receiving e-mails on both our desktops with Ubuntu 22.04 since we upgraded to Thunderbird 115.5.0. It mostly happens after booting the machines in the morning, but sometimes it also occurs spontaneously during the day. Internet works well, so does sending e-mails. Shutting down and booting again will help sometimes, but I also have to restart the router upstairs (Netgear) again from time to time. I checked all settings, closed Surfshark VPN, contacted our provider that checked the connections up to their modem / router in our home, everything was fine. I then installed another router (ASUS RT-AC87U) that gave the same problem. Also installed a timer that switches on half an hour before booting both computers so that we do not have to switch it off manually and we are sure the router already had a reset. Another issue on both computers: when some times we cannot receive e-mails and we reset router or computers, some e-mails that had been deleted reappear in the Inbox as if we had not opened them...... You might imagine that I am at the end of my possibilities to find a solution. Would you please help me? Kind regards, Ed (I sent this question twice before, presumably to the wrong dept.)
creator: edschijf

title: Emails not appearing in Inbox - even though I receive the alerts and beeps +
content:
I am on W10 using TB Ver 115.6.0 on a HP I7 with 16 Gb RAM and 1TB SSD. TB is hosted by GMAIL - this is a Godsend as in general my former Uni was MS Mad.

Some emails are coming through normally. BUT, others are apparently arriving and then disappearing.

Here is what is happening.

I get a TB alert (bottom right corner) and beep to say arrival. I look in the inbox and the email(s) is(are) not there ! I look in All Mail and I get a flash on the screen where they appear in All Mail and then the screen refreshes and they are not there and the screen returns the All Mail pane to the state before the new emails ``arrived."

Clearly I am concerned that I am missing emails.

Moreover, sometimes I get a flash that they are in inbox then the screen refreshes and they have disappeared (like above with All Mail but less frequently). All refreshes are automatic and instantaneous .

Also prior to this problem I could force that diappeared into the inbox by rebooting or re-starting - this must be a big clue . But oddly not now.

These emails clearly exist and are going somewhere.

Any clear ideas about what is going on?

It looks to me that the FETCH command is no longer working properly .

Also the numbers in the inbox seem crazy too large on the main pane on the left - see image - what are they supposed to refer to ?

NB: TB has been stable for some months but every 3/4 months some new problem emerges. 

        The GMAIL interface has also been stable and is very good and has retained many TB users          who were otherwise being forced into the MS camp especially in the UK Unis. So it would be          helpful if Support would recognise this and and think about what might be happening

Best Gilbert PS I do not change anything on TB ever - but I experience many problems.
creator: gilbert.mackenzie.cbs

title: Přetažení přílohy emailu myší / Dragging an email attachment with the mouse
content:
Zdravím,

ve staré verzi Thuderbird jsem si mohl přilohu .PDF došlého emailu uložit na plochu nebo do otevřené složky přetažením myší. V nové verzi mohu přílohu jed stáhnout. Když přílohu přesunu myší, nepřesune se příloha, ale application-pdf. Je možné to někde v nastavení změnit aby šli soubory z emailu uložit přetažením?

Předem děkuji za odpoveď. Jan

Hello,

In the old version of Thuderbird, I could save a .PDF attachment of an incoming email to the desktop or to an open folder by dragging it with the mouse. In the new version I can download the attachment. When I move the attachment with the mouse, it doesn't move the attachment but the application-pdf. Is it possible to change this somewhere in the settings to save files from an email by dragging and dropping?

Thank you in advance for the answer. Jan

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)
creator: cerovsky65

title: Maximize reading pane
content:
Hi!

I'm trying to help my elderly father with Thunderbird, but I just can't get it the way he used to have it.

The problem is that he wants to have a reading pane below the list of emails, and he no longer can make the list of emails show less, like only three emails or so. Because he has poor eye sight, he needs to have Windows on low resolution, and because of this, only half of his screen is used for actual showing the content of the email.

I have attached a screenshot of his screen, and as you can see, the reading pane at the bottom shows very little of the email. He can of course double click on it to get a full screen view, but he would prefere not to. So what he is asking for is how to make the box with the list of emails smaller, the box that is right above the reading box.

Thank you very much in advance for any help.

Regards, Ulf

title: Hotmail & Outlook Email accounts can no longer send emails
content:
I am running Thunderbird 115.5.0 (64-bit) on Ubuntu 22.04.

I have two accounts with email MS - one with Hotmail, and the other with Outlook.

Both continue to receive emails without issue.

Recently, neither can send emails - having been able to send emails for years.

They had different SMTP servers, so I checked to see if I was using the correct server, and both appear as being correct.

I tried adding one account (again) to ensure TB would select the correct server, ... and it still cannot send emails, but still receives emails.

I have tried both with oAuth for the password, but that has stopped working.

I can find nothing online, and feel like I have exhausted the internet for solutions, so if anyone can help, it would be most appreciated, as I am sure others will be as frustrated.

Many thanks,

title: Mail display subsystem <postmaster>
content: For a month or so now I have been receiving emails headed up as from "Mail delivery subsystem <postmaster>". The subject line is always "Cannot display unicode". The rest of the message is made up of gobbledegook - line after line (sometimes page after page) of computer code. Somewhere within this code I can usually recognise the sender's email address and often the message itself. These emails can come from unsolicited marketing sources and also, worryingly, often come from trusted regular correpondents. Not every message from them is corrupted in this way. I am a claranet customer and have discussed this problem with their customer services department. The messages appear clear and legible on their client portal webmail service so they advise that the problem must be at the Thunderbird level. Can you please help. This is a frustrating problem which requires much tedious effort to ensure day to day emails can be read and responded to.
creator: phil213

title: Hey Matt, What is OFF Topic? I created the topic. Closing these questions is why the problems exist.
content:
"Matt: This is all off topic, so to save me having to read anymore of it, I am locking this off topic item."

Hey Matt, What is OFF Topic? I created the topic. Closing these questions is why the problems continue to exist.

Your solutions do not fix the problem. I should not have to be a CSS coder to get previously used functions back.

Just because it is easy for you, does not mean it is easy for everybody.

Put Menu Bar back at the top.

Put Sort/Threads back in the latest version.

Provide a way to globally set the Sort Threads .

Let the power users select these restrictive features and let the rest of us keep the old functions.
